column4: Um, fnf:  I couldn't find a Thunderbird package at getdeb.net, unfortunately!
The one I used from Add/Remove is a really old version.
I downloaded a new one from Mozilla, Paddy_EIRE, but I've no idea how to install from a tar.gz.  I tried extracting and using the ./configure, make and make install way, but it didn't work.
What's an aptitude install then?  Paddy_EIRE:  I've no idea about Mint Flavours.  I'm using Ubuntu 7.04.
Um, is that a particular extension?
For information about installing, running and configuring Thunderbird
including a list of known issues and troubleshooting information,
Just say when it's downloaded, fnf! :)
found a repo for latest thunderbird
Is that like... a deb package?
Done that!  Now what do I do?
Nevermind, got it doing now, thanks :)
